items.label: Chapter 6: NVIDIA Isaac Sim & Isaac ROS
Appendix B: Jetson Orin Nano Setup

capstone/autonomous-humanoid-robot.title: Chapter 10: Capstone: Autonomous Humanoid Robot
capstone/autonomous-humanoid-robot.description: Welcome to the final chapter of the textbook! In this capstone project, you'll bring together everything you've learned to design, build, and program your very own autonomous humanoid robot.

chapter-outline.title: Chapter Outline
chapter-outline.description: This document provides a brief outline of each chapter in the textbook.

chapters/conversational-robotics.title: Chapter 8: Conversational Robotics (GPT + Whisper)
chapters/conversational-robotics.description: In this chapter, we'll explore how to create robots that you can talk to! We'll be using two powerful AI models from OpenAI: GPT, a large language model, and Whisper, a speech-to-text model.

chapters/gazebo-and-unity-simulation.title: Chapter 5: Gazebo & Unity Simulation
chapters/gazebo-and-unity-simulation.description: Simulation is a crucial tool in robotics. It allows us to test and develop robot software without needing access to a physical robot, and it enables us to safely test our code in a wide variety of scenarios. In this chapter, we'll explore two of the most popular robotics simulators: Gazebo and Unity.

chapters/humanoid-locomotion-and-manipul.title: Chapter 9: Humanoid Locomotion & Manipulation
chapters/humanoid-locomotion-and-manipul.description: In this chapter, we'll tackle two of the most challenging and fascinating aspects of humanoid robotics: locomotion and manipulation.

chapters/humanoid-robotics-foundations.title: Chapter 2: Humanoid Robotics Foundations
chapters/humanoid-robotics-foundations.description: In this chapter, we'll delve into the foundational concepts of humanoid robotics, exploring their history, anatomy, and the key components that make them work.

chapters/nvidia-isaac-sim-and-isaac-ros.title: Chapter 6: NVIDIA Isaac Sim & Isaac ROS
chapters/nvidia-isaac-sim-and-isaac-ros.description: In this chapter, we'll dive into the powerful world of NVIDIA's robotics platform. NVIDIA Isaac Sim is a photorealistic robotics simulator, and Isaac ROS provides a collection of hardware-accelerated packages for ROS 2. Together, they form a powerful ecosystem for developing and deploying high-performance robots.

chapters/ros-2-fundamentals.title: Chapter 4: ROS 2 Fundamentals
chapters/ros-2-fundamentals.description: Welcome to the world of ROS 2! The Robot Operating System (ROS) is an open-source framework for writing robot software. It's a powerful tool that is used by robotics researchers and professionals around the world. In this chapter, we'll cover the fundamental concepts of ROS 2.

chapters/sensors-and-perception.title: Chapter 3: Sensors & Perception
chapters/sensors-and-perception.description: In this chapter, we'll explore the fascinating world of robot sensors and perception. Just like humans use their senses to understand the world, robots use sensors to gather information about their environment.

chapters/vision-language-action-robotics.title: Chapter 7: Vision-Language-Action Robotics
chapters/vision-language-action-robotics.description: Welcome to the cutting-edge of robotics! In this chapter, we'll explore the exciting field of Vision-Language-Action (VLA) robotics. VLA models are a type of AI that can understand natural language, perceive the world through vision, and take actions in the physical world.

chapters/what-is-physical-ai.title: Chapter 1: What is Physical AI
chapters/what-is-physical-ai.description: Welcome to the first chapter of our journey into the world of Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics! In this chapter, we'll explore the fundamental question: What is Physical AI?

hardware/jetson-orin-nano-setup.title: Appendix B: Jetson Orin Nano Setup
hardware/jetson-orin-nano-setup.description: The NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano is a powerful, compact, and energy-efficient AI computer that is ideal for robotics. In this appendix, we'll walk you through the process of setting up a Jetson Orin Nano for use with this textbook.

hardware/realsense-integration.title: Appendix C: RealSense Integration
hardware/realsense-integration.description: Intel RealSense cameras are a popular choice for robotics due to their ability to provide high-quality depth and color data in a compact and affordable package. In this appendix, we'll show you how to integrate a RealSense camera with ROS 2.

hardware/robot-lab-tiers.title: Appendix D: Robot Lab Tiers
hardware/robot-lab-tiers.description: Building a robot lab can be a daunting task, but it doesn't have to be expensive. In this appendix, we'll provide recommendations for building a robot lab at three different budget tiers: budget, mid-range, and premium.

hardware/workstation-specs.title: Appendix A: Workstation Specs
hardware/workstation-specs.description: To get the most out of this textbook, you'll need a computer that can handle robotics simulation and AI development. Here are our recommendations for workstation and laptop specifications.

preface.title: Preface
preface.description: This textbook is designed for students in grades 9-12 who are interested in the fields of artificial intelligence and robotics. Our goal is to provide a comprehensive, accessible, and engaging introduction to the exciting world of Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics.

weekly-breakdown.title: Weekly Breakdown: A 13-Week Curriculum
weekly-breakdown.description: This document provides a sample 13-week curriculum for a course based on this textbook.
